ovdesc.p: All in One Account module enables the Banks to define Account based Loan and Deposit products. The loan/ deposit accounts opened under this module, based on a pre defined All in One Products, are different from the Contract based Loans and Deposits, in view of flexibility in operations, like a normal account. The repayment schedules defined under this module are for the purpose of reference with the account balance, for arriving at the arrears or allowing redraw facilities, on the scheduled dates.
AZ.ACCOUNTING describes the parameter details of All in One Account Products.

By using this file, Banks can define various types of Loan / Deposit Products under All In One Module (AZ Module) like Education Loan, Housing Loan, Car loan etc., with different features unique to each type of Product.
The AZ accounts opened under a particular All in One product, inherits the default features of the product like penal rate, Repayment type, Maximum Interest only period, etc.
However, at AZ account level also, changes are accepted to override the defaulted values.

Certain validations like minimum term, maximum term, allowed category, maximum back date, minimum and maximum amount (in the case of deposit) are done at the AZ account, with respect to the values defined under the corresponding AZ Product.

In case of a loan during I schedule the system would raise an entry to debit the az.account with 392/391 as the txn code. During N schedule the system would raise an entry to credit the az account with the value defined in the first multi value of INT.CR.CAP.

Defines named values to indicate if an option applies to the associated NR.ATTRIBUTE. More than one option can be associated with the NR.ATTRIBUTE, with certain restrictions.
Valid Inputs are NEGOTIABLE, NON-NEGOTIABLE, OVERRIDE, FIX-VALUE, MANDATORY as described below: -
NEGOTIABLE
The value of NEGOTIABLE will indicate that the associated NR.ATTRIBUTE can be negotiated at the arrangement level.
NON-NEGOTIABLE
The value of NON-NEGOTIABLE will indicate that the associated NR.ATTRIBUTE cannot be negotiated at the arrangement level. Both NEGOTIABLE and NON-NEGOTIABLE cannot be defined together
OVERRIDE
Specifies if a default override message should be generated if the default attribute is amended at the arrangement level. If OVERRIDE is not specified, no override will be generated.
FIX-VALUE
Specified if the field value is to be fixed at the arrangement level. If FIX-VALUE is not specified the field value will vary with the changes to the underlying product condition.
MANDATORY
Specifies if the attribute is mandatory for this product condition. Can only be specified where the attribute is not defined as mandatory in the property class.
